channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The suspect in the shooting of 2 Minnesota lawmakers has been captured and charged
item.description: Vance Boelter was captured in a wooded area on Sunday night, and charged in the shootings of two state lawmakers and their spouses. His first court appearance is scheduled for Monday.
item.content:encoded:
Vance Boelter was captured in a wooded area on Sunday night, and charged in the shootings of two state lawmakers and their spouses. His first court appearance is scheduled for Monday.

(Image credit: Hennepin County Sheriff's Office)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: This mother relies on SNAP to help feed her kids. Now, she's bracing for cuts
item.description: Millions of people who use the food assistance program SNAP are facing changes: on what food they can buy, how much money they'll receive or even if they'll still qualify for the program.
item.content:encoded:
Millions of people who use the food assistance program SNAP are facing changes: on what food they can buy, how much money they'll receive or even if they'll still qualify for the program.

(Image credit: Jay Fram)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Britain's MI6 spy agency names first female chief
item.description: It's a case of real life catching up with James Bond fiction: Britain's MI6 spy agency named its first-ever female chief. She used to be Q. Now she'll be C.
item.content:encoded:
It's a case of real life catching up with James Bond fiction: Britain's MI6 spy agency named its first-ever female chief. She used to be Q. Now she'll be C.

(Image credit: Kin Cheung)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Minnesota shooting suspect arrested. And, takeaways from Trump's military parade
item.description: The man suspected of killing a Democratic Minnesota lawmaker has been arrested and charged with murder. And, takeaways from Trump's military parade and the No Kings protests.
item.content:encoded:
The man suspected of killing a Democratic Minnesota lawmaker has been arrested and charged with murder. And, takeaways from Trump's military parade and the No Kings protests.

(Image credit: Ramsey County Sheriff Bob Fletcher)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Israel hits more Iranian military targets, Iran retaliates on fourth day of conflict
item.description: Trump said Sunday he remained optimistic about Israel and Iran reaching a deal, but added "sometimes they have to fight it out."
item.content:encoded:
Trump said Sunday he remained optimistic about Israel and Iran reaching a deal, but added "sometimes they have to fight it out."

(Image credit: Baz Ratner)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Emergency alerts go out in Spanish and English, but what happens if you speak another language?
item.description: The FCC has delayed implementing its multilingual emergency alerts system — making non-English speakers vulnerable during climate disasters.
item.content:encoded:
The FCC has delayed implementing its multilingual emergency alerts system — making non-English speakers vulnerable during climate disasters.

(Image credit: Chris Delmas)
item.dc:creator: Nate Perez

item.title: Israel's conflict with Iran takes focus even as Gaza war grinds on
item.description: Israel's conflict with Iran is pushing its war in Gaza to the periphery. But Palestinians there are still being killed and are under a near-total blockade.
item.content:encoded: Israel's conflict with Iran is pushing its war in Gaza to the periphery. But Palestinians there are still being killed and are under a near-total blockade.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: North Koreans fighting for Russia against Ukraine have grown skilled in drone warfare
item.description: North Korea sent 11,000 elite soldiers to support Russia. Their progress — especially in drone warfare — has implications not only for Russia's war on Ukraine but also peace on the Korean Peninsula.
item.content:encoded:
North Korea sent 11,000 elite soldiers to support Russia. Their progress — especially in drone warfare — has implications not only for Russia's war on Ukraine but also peace on the Korean Peninsula.

(Image credit: Anton Shtuka for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Elon Musk may be gone but DOGE isn't done remaking the federal government
item.description: Even though the billionaire is no longer leading the Department of Government Efficiency effort, many key staffers — and DOGE ideas — are now more permanently embedded in the federal government.
item.content:encoded:
Even though the billionaire is no longer leading the Department of Government Efficiency effort, many key staffers — and DOGE ideas — are now more permanently embedded in the federal government.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: After early reprieve from immigration enforcement, farming industry reckons with raids
item.description: The Trump administration's immigration enforcement mostly left farms and meat packing plants alone, until coordinated raids last week. Now, President Trump is signaling continued support for farmers.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration's immigration enforcement mostly left farms and meat packing plants alone, until coordinated raids last week. Now, President Trump is signaling continued support for farmers.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo
